squidpony.squidgrid.fov

Class ShadowFOV

  • java.lang.Object
    • squidpony.squidgrid.fov.ShadowFOV
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FOVSolver

    public class ShadowFOV
extends java.lang.Object
implements FOVSolver
    Recursive shadowcasting FOV. Uses force * decay for the radius calculation and treats all translucent cells as fully transparent. Assumes that it will hit an opaque cell before running off the map edge, therefor does not do any bounds checking. In order to avoid errors if passing in a subsection that is not edged with all opaque cells, please ensure the section's width and height are sufficient to contain the radius.
    Author:
    Eben Howard - http://squidpony.com - eben@squidpony.com

    • Method Detail

      • calculateFOV

        public float[][] calculateFOV(float[][] map,
                     int startx,
                     int starty,
                     float force,
                     float decay,
                     boolean simplifiedDiagonals)
        Description copied from interface: FOVSolver
        Calculates the Field Of View for the provided map from the given x, y coordinates. Returns a lightmap for a result where the values represent a percentage of fully lit. In general a value equal to or below 0 means that cell is not in the field of view, whereas a value equal to or above 1 means that cell is fully in the field of view. Note that values below 0 and above 1 may be returned in certain circumstances. In these cases it is up to the calling class to determine how to treat such values. The starting point for the calculations is considered to be at the center of the origin cell. Each whole number reaches one cell away horizontally and vertically.
        Specified by:
        calculateFOV in interface FOVSolver
        Parameters:
        map - the grid of cells to calculate on
        startx - the horizontal component of the starting location
        starty - the vertical component of the starting location
        force - the power of the ray
        decay - how much the light is reduced for each whole integer step in distance
        simplifiedDiagonals - if true then diagonal distances are treated as if they are the same distance as horizontal and vertical distances
        Returns:
        the computed light grid

      • calculateFOV

        public float[][] calculateFOV(float[][] map,
                     int startx,
                     int starty,
                     float radius)
        Description copied from interface: FOVSolver
        Calculates the Field of View in the same manner as the version with more parameters. Assumes decay to be 1, so light will extend to the radius value. Uses simplified diagonals. Uses the empty String for the key.
        Specified by:
        calculateFOV in interface FOVSolver
        Parameters:
        map - the grid of cells to calculate on
        Returns:
